p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) is an arbovirus belonging to the Togaviridae family, Alphavirus genus causing an acute febrile syndrome with severe and debilitating arthralgia 1 , 2 , 3 , 4. The viral particle is approximately 60-70 nm in diameter and composed of an icosahedral capsid surrounded by a lipid envelope. The viral genome consists of a single stranded positive sense RNA of 12kb in length, which encodes four non-structural proteins (NSP1-4) and five structural proteins (C, E3, E2, 6K and E1) 5 , 6 , 7.
